poem:
**Capitol Landscape**  

Cherry trees scatter,  
their petals like whispers—  
boots tread softly,  
raking rebellions of leaves  
into orderly piles.  

Troops, silent as shadows,  
sweep the stories  
of unseen lives—  
unwritten chapters  
in Washington's breath.  

A broom brushes  
across sun-dappled ground—  
autumn's countenance,  
a momentary reprieve,  
in this city of echoes.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
